titlestmt.titleproper: American Association for Clinical Chemistry Standards Committee records 1960-1994 1960s-1980s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Association for Clinical Chemistry Standards Committee records

bioghist.p: The American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC) is an international scientific/medical society of clinical laboratory professionals, physicians, research scientists and other individuals involved with clinical chemistry and clinical laboratory science disciplines. Founded in 1948, the society has 9,500 members and is headquartered in Washington, DC. AACC is subdivided geographically into 22 local sections. Nathan Radin was the past editor of the American Association for Clinical Chemistry newsletter.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the Standards Committee of the AACC from 1960-1981. Materials include summary reports of meetings of the Standards Committee, memoranda and proposals from various study groups and subcommittees, biographical sketches of AACC symposium speakers, meeting agendas, printed reference material from offices such as the National Bureau of Standards, and information about the structure, purpose and membership of the Standards Committee and its subcommittees.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records (97:08;01:07;02:02).
